snippet: Turkey sharply stepped up its confrontation with Syria, forcing a plane to land on suspicion of carrying military cargo and warning of more force if Syrian shelling continues.
abstract: Turkey sharply escalates its confrontation with Syria, forcing Syrian passenger plane to land on suspicion of carrying military cargo, ordering Turkish civilian airplanes to avoid Syria’s airspace and warning of forceful responses if Syrian artillery gunners keep lobbing shells across border; rising tensions are seen as especially troublesome because Turkey is member of NATO, which considers attack on one member attack on all.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and SEBNEM ARSU
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Sebnem Arsu from Hatay, Turkey. Reporting was contributed by Christine Hauser and Rick Gladstone from New York, Alan Cowell from Paris, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Turkey sharply stepped up its confrontation with Syria, forcing a plane to land on suspicion of carrying military cargo and warning of more force if Syrian shelling continues.

headline.seo: Turkey Forces Syrian Plane to Land
headline.main: Turkey, Seeking Weapons, Forces Syrian Jet to Land
headline.print_headline: Turkey, Seeking Weapons, Forces Syrian Jet to Land
